body_html:
@niruyadla : I'll try to add one of the speech models (hopefully submitted tomorrow) with both float and quant models to help you with your porting process.

I'd be curious to how you plan to create your models to run via TFLite on your audio platforms. There isn't currently an easy path from Tensorflow for RNNs/LSTMs besides hand-creating the models.

Given that the Tensorflow to TFLite conversion process is still very difficult for LSTMs, the original thought was to remove these tests since we didn't think the community would
use these model tests (or the LSTM kernels) until the conversion process was ready. You both are the first to bring this up in the last several months since they were first public.

I'd be curious to how you plan to create your models to run via TFLite on your audio platforms. There isn't currently an easy path from Tensorflow for RNNs/LSTMs besides hand-creating the models.
Given that the Tensorflow to TFLite conversion process is still very difficult for LSTMs, the original thought was to remove these tests since we didn't think the community would
use these model tests (or the LSTM kernels) until the conversion process was ready.  You both are the first to bring this up in the last several months since they were first public.
body:
@niruyadla : I'll try to add one of the speech models (hopefully submitted tomorrow) with both float and quant models to help you with your porting process.

I'd be curious to how you plan to create your models to run via TFLite on your audio platforms. There isn't currently an easy path from Tensorflow for RNNs/LSTMs besides hand-creating the models.

Given that the Tensorflow to TFLite conversion process is still very difficult for LSTMs, the original thought was to remove these tests since we didn't think the community would
use these model tests (or the LSTM kernels) until the conversion process was ready.  You both are the first to bring this up in the last several months since they were first public.
